description:
It might be best to remove the volume code associated with these warnings,
given the cinder split. At least the warnings should be suppressed unless the code
is actually needed.

Warnings in /var/log/nova/compute.log

2013-12-16 14:36:01.176 WARNING nova.virt.libvirt.utils [req-a00e33ec-9abb-43e2-a79f-1277e0800095 USERNAME 841615a3-ece9-4622-9fa0-fdc178ed34f8] systool is not installed
2013-12-16 14:36:01.316 WARNING nova.virt.libvirt.utils [req-a00e33ec-9abb-43e2-a79f-1277e0800095 USERNAME 841615a3-ece9-4622-9fa0-fdc178ed34f8] systool is not installed
title: stale volume related warnings reported for systool

comments.content:
It might be best to remove the volume code associated with these warnings,
given the cinder split. At least the warnings should be suppressed unless the code
is actually needed.

Warnings in /var/log/nova/compute.log

2013-12-16 14:36:01.176 WARNING nova.virt.libvirt.utils [req-a00e33ec-9abb-43e2-a79f-1277e0800095 USERNAME 841615a3-ece9-4622-9fa0-fdc178ed34f8] systool is not installed
2013-12-16 14:36:01.316 WARNING nova.virt.libvirt.utils [req-a00e33ec-9abb-43e2-a79f-1277e0800095 USERNAME 841615a3-ece9-4622-9fa0-fdc178ed34f8] systool is not installed
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~p-draigbrady

comments.content: Agreed, its worth a quick tidy.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~johngarbutt

comments.content: Attach volume still goes through Nova.  So be careful when removing volume related code from Nova.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~xing-yang

comments.content:
Do not remove this code! 

 Amazing that anyone would suggest removing code simply because it throws a warning.  

 This code is for doing Fibre Channel LUN attachments to VMs.   systool is required in order to discover the FC HBAs installed.   This is called when building a connector object to pass to cinder.  It's completely normal to get a warning if systool isn't installed if you don't use FibreChannel.   If you are trying to use Fibre  Channel, you would want to see these warnings.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~walter-boring

comments.content:
Xing, Walt: Thanks for your inputs.

The code in here is similar to that in "cinder/brick/initiator/linuxfc.py". This seems inline to what the bug report suggests about cinder .

Now I understand that this code is essential to discover the fc hbas on the compute node. To discover these, "systool -c fc_host -v" command is used and the warning is presented if systool command doesn't exist on the compute node.

So, we don't have to delete this code and keep it as it is. And close this bug?

Please correct me if I am wrong.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~dharmitshah

comments.content:
@walter-boring sure, the code should not be removed if still need it for attach. There has been lots of other dead code found from things nova no longer users, I assumed this was another one.

Perhaps the warning should mention its only required if you need Fibre Channel LUN attachments to VMs, when using libvirt. That would make this much less confusing.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~johngarbutt
